intro: Touterea rusbyi, commonly known as the Hawaiian tree fern, is a member of the Cyatheaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, including Hawaii, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features a tall, unbranched trunk covered in persistent, fibrous roots, with large, feather-like fronds emerging from the top. Its fronds can grow up to several meters in length and are typically bioluminescent under certain conditions. Touterea rusbyi plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various species.
